text: Stephen McClaren (born 3 May 1961) is an English former professional footballer and coach who currently serves as an assistant coach for Premier League club Manchester United, in his second spell at the club. ==Managerial statistics== Managerial record by team and tenure Team From To Record Record Record Record Record Team From To Middlesbrough 12 June 2001 11 May 2006 England 1 August 2006 22 November 2007 Twente 20 June 2008 11 May 2010 VfL Wolfsburg 11 May 2010 7 February 2011 Nottingham Forest 13 June 2011 2 October 2011 Twente 5 January 2012 26 February 2013 For KNVB Cup matches: Derby County 30 September 2013 25 May 2015 Newcastle United 10 June 2015 11 March 2016 Derby County 30 September 2013 25 May 2015 Queens Park Rangers 18 May 2018 1 April 2019 Total Total Total ==Honours== ===Player=== Derby County *Football League Second Division: 1986–87 ===Manager=== Middlesbrough *Football League Cup: 2003–04"Rock solid Steve" – BBC Sport profile, 4 May 2006 *UEFA Cup runner-up: 2005–06 Twente *Eredivisie: 2009–10 Individual *Rinus Michels Award: 2010 ==References== Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:English footballers Category:English football managers Category:England national football team managers Category:Bristol City F.C. players Category:Derby County F.C. players Category:People from York Category:Eredivisie managers Category:Bundesliga managers Category:Association football coaches
title: Steve McClaren
